title: Stock Transfer Initiated Event
description: Published when a stock transfer between warehouse locations is initiated. This marks the beginning of the transfer lifecycle and reserves the inventory at the source location. Common use cases include pick face replenishment, zone rebalancing, consolidation, and cross-docking operations. The transfer will progress through in-transit status before completion.

transfer_id.description: Unique identifier for the transfer operation, used to track the transfer through its complete lifecycle

sku.description: Stock Keeping Unit identifier - the unique product code within the inventory system

source_location.description: Originating warehouse location code in format: Warehouse-Zone-Aisle-Shelf-Bin. Inventory will be decremented from this location.

destination_location.description: Target warehouse location code. Inventory will be incremented at this location upon completion.

quantity.description: Number of units to transfer from source to destination location

initiated_by.description: User identifier (email or username) of the warehouse operator who initiated the transfer

reason.description: Business reason for the transfer, supporting operational analytics and audit trail
reason.example: Replenishment to pick face - forward pick area running low
